Job Title: Production Manager

Location: Wheeling, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing, Production

Description:
Job Title: Production ManagerEmployment Type: Full-Time / Exempt 
About Us:Vantedge Medical is the premier metals-based med-tech solutions partner from concept to full-scale manufacturing. We are at the forefront of precision engineering and innovation, specializing in the development and manufacturing of vital components for medical markets such as Robotic Assisted Surgery, Orthopedics, Surgical Instruments, Dental, and more. Our teams work in unison, collaborating and problem-solving to serve the manufacturing needs of the top Medical Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) around the globe. Making a difference in the lives of patients and their families drives us to go above and beyond every day. With a steadfast commitment to advancing medical technology, we take immense pride in the work we do â€“ and have a lot of fun doing it. 
About the Role:The Production Manager is responsible for managing employee assignments, machine usage, and the production process. This role ensures employees meet the productivity and efficiency standards of the organization. They are also responsible for implementing production schedules and plans and directing production activities. Also accountable for results related to costs, methods, on-time production, and personnel. 
Responsibilities: Organizes and oversees the work and schedules of departmental supervisors.Leads and motivates subordinates to fulfill schedules, improve processes, control costs, and deliver quality work.Reviews usage and makes recommendation regarding costs, materials, and efficiencies of manufacturing production.Reviews logs, datasheets, and reports to assess production.Identifies process abnormalities or inefficiencies then addresses those problems by determining and implementing appropriate changes.Submits periodic production reports to the Plant Manager or other appropriate staff.Ensures employee compliance with plant safety, environmental, and operational standards and regulations.Along with other departments, implements new production processes and required equipment.Handles discipline and termination of employees as needed and in accordance with company policy.Train, coach and supervise employees to attain optimum performance considering every employee.Conducts performance evaluations that are timely and constructive.Performs other related duties as assigned. 
Requirements / Skills: Bachelor or Associate degree in management related degree or equivalent years of applicable experience.5 years of related experience, preferably in a precision, medical technology environment.Lean Six Sigma training and certification is a plus.Effective written and verbal communication skills.Effective managerial and supervisory skills.Effective analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.Extensive technical knowledge of CNC manufacturingProficient in Microsoft Office Suite or similar software.Physical Requirements:Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.Must be able to lift fifteen pounds at times.Ability to frequently walk through the manufacturing facility.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
